text: the assembly will hear an address by his
majesty King maswati
III head of state of the kingdom of
eswatini I request protocol to escort
his
majesty on behalf of the general
assembly I have the honor to welcome his
majesty King mawati thei Head of the
State of the Kingdom
M and invite him to address the the
assembly your majesty your
[Music]
majesty
Mr
President your majesties your
excellencies heads of state and
government the United Nations Secretary
General distinguished delegates ladies
and
gentlemen it is a great honor for me to
address this uh
78th General Assembly under the theme
rebuilding trust and reigniting Global
solidarity accelerating action on the
2030 agenda and its sustainable
development goals towards peace
prosperity progress and
sustainability for
all in a world faced with complex
challenges such as climate change
poverty inequality and resource
depletion it has become increasingly
evident that sustainable development is
not just a noble aspiration but is an
imperative for the survival and
well-being of our planet and its
inhabitants for 78 years the United
Nations has stood for the great ideal of
building an International System of GL
of collaboration solidarity and common
purpose the values of the UN Charter
which are our road map today will remain
as such for generations to come because
the United Nations is founded on the
Timeless ideals of Global Peace security
development human rights and uh Global
cooperation
today we need unity in our organization
more than ever
before among the multiple crisis we are
experiencing are the impact of the coid
19 pandemic geopolitical conflict and
wars and the climate change
catastrophy these have undermined our
resilience and increased
vulnerability to shocks and
significantly slowed the progress to
achieve the sdg by
2030 just as the founders of the UN once
United to address the challenges of
their time for the benefit of all it is
now our
responsibility to stand together and to
confront those we face is today rebuild
trust and take Swift action to achieve
the sustainable development goals and
the African agenda
2063 of great concern are the conflicts
around the world the cause and the
unconstitutional change of governments
in several African states which are NE
neg ating the gains towards attaining
our Au
goals we have also witnessed natural
disasters in the form of floods and
earthquakes that have claimed thousands
of lives in Libya and Morocco among
others we wish to extend our
sympathy our sympathies and
condolences to those who have lost their
love
ones the kingdom of estin wishes to
encourage the efforts that are being
undertaken to find a political solution
to the matter regarding the Western
Sahara within the parameters of the
United Nations security Council
resolution
2022 we command the United Nations
Secretary General and his person Envoy
to progress dialogue as means to
reaching a sustainable solution to the
impass to attain this we need to
actively practice tolerance and promote
peace in all areas we owe it to
ourselves to reignite Global solidarity
to achieve economic and social
advancement for all our
peoples Mr President
the kingdom of eswatini Embraces
multilateral cooperation and prioritizes
adherance to International laws when
looking to address the challenges posed
by conflicts and Wars we therefore
support the global call for silencing of
guns which affect the most vulnerable
groups we remain steadyfast in our call
for peaceful
resolutions peaceful resolution of
conflicts and the continual Improvement
of democratic and inclusive
governance the kingdom of stini
therefore commends the UN General the UN
Secretary General for facilitating the
new agenda for peace which promotes the
principles of trust and solidarity that
are Foundation
of the UN
Charter estin supports women empowerment
and youth participation in decision
making for conflict prevention and
development we should work to advance
gender equality and end violence against
women our focus is on building account
accountable effective and inclusive
institutions aligned with SG
16 we have established a legal aid
office to enhance access to Justice and
the rule of law Especial for vulnerable
and marginalized
groups we have also developed an
implementation plan for the universal
periodic review on human rights and
strengthen National institutions of
monitoring and Reporting Frameworks to
promote and protect human rights for
allas like all other member states estin
is implementation of the sdg has been
impacted by the multiple shocks both at
Global and National levels not
withstanding these challenges as a
country we remain stayfast in our
commitment to achieve these uh
targets we have been ranked top five by
the World Bank for our growing economy
with our GDP growth at about
7.8% we attained the second greatest
manufacturing value added per
capita H per capita country and placed
sixth on the 2022 Africa
industrialization ER
index furthermore we have been ranked
number nine amongst the 10 African
countries with the highest GDP per
capita we will not rest on our Laurels
but work much harder as we look to
improve our
economy Mr President the recent Global
challenges had negative impact on our
ability to provide social services
including health and
education despite this we have
significantly reduced the rate of under
five deaths and the maternal mortality
ratio in estin the HIV prevalence
amongst adults age 15 to 49 has dropped
has also dropped we continue to work
tirelessly to strengthen our Health Care
Systems while also ensuring that our
citizens have access to these essential
Services we commend the UN Secretary
General for the many initiatives aimed
at helping member states to recover
better from these multiple shocks
following our participation in the
transforming education Summit last year
we are delighted to share that the
country continues to increase
opportunities for learning and skills
development including through the
integration and use of digital
Technologies significant strides have
been made by the kingdom of stini in
increasing access to electricity since
adoption of the 2030
agenda we now have National coverage
above 80% also notable progress ress has
been made in terms of Road and ICT
infrastructure connecting cities and
economic
zones when it comes to access to basic
Water Services
69% of the population now enjoy this
necessity and access to basic Sanitation
Services has reached
58% of our
people the literus rate among adults
aged 15 and above has improved from 90
from
79% in 200 to
87% the cross enrollment ratio for
primary education is increased from
104% in the lead up to to the SG Summit
this week the kingdom of estin undertook
a series of consultations in each region
seeking the views of the people
regarding how best to accelerate the
attainment of the
SGS as a result the kingdom has
prioritized investments in key areas in
the remaining seven years we want to
create decent jobs and employment
opportunities for everyone especially
the
youth we want to improve water and
sanitation for all we are convinced that
this will help secure maximum progress
across all 17
SGS Mr
President Astin has continued to cherish
a homegrown and unique model of a people
driven Democratic governance like like
many other
democracies our constitution recognizes
the role of the monarchy as well as a
bicameral Parliament separation of
powers fundamental human rights and the
rule of law it takes into account our
Rich cultural heritage and traditional
African values in in that it is grounded
in respect consensus and Community
Support not through traditional
structures it is a monarchical
democracy our system is based on
individual Merit where candidates are
nominated from their communities to
stand for elections in constituencies
which will call which we call Ding to
which they are
accountable the electorate expects
members of Parliament to meet as
colleagues rather than combat combatants
to look for consensus as opposed to
partisanship and to balance the interest
of their constituencies with those of
the
nation in terms of our Democratic
dispensation elections are a
constitutional imperative and are held
every 5 years astini is in the middle of
our electoral cycle in a bid to elect
the 12th
parliament in this regard a voter
registration exercise was conducted
which rained over 95% registered against
an eligible po
population this was a resounding success
and the ringing endorsement of the
support for the syst system of
government as we speak the nomination
process has been completed primary
elections were held on the 26th August
2023 and our secondary elections will be
taking place 29th September
2023 we are looking forward to emasti
expressing their desires Through The
Ballot Box
Sia remains one of our highest
institutions
where dialogue and play their part in
determining the future they want it is
an inclusive Forum where citizens
irrespective of gender and social status
discussed issues of national
interest a couple of weeks ago the
nation was celebrating 55 years of our
independence during which Mas have been
living in peace and
Harmony Mr
President estin has been hit hard by the
coid 19 pandemic which has affected some
of our social
sectors although we have made progress
in reducing poverty and inequality they
remain high as a result we continue to
battle with high unemployment especially
among the youth with the support of the
United Nations in eswatini we have
launched a Youth Empowerment program
which has generated great public
interest from the private sector we hope
to enroll at least 4,000 young people
into the program to increase their
chances of employment help them start
their own businesses and with access to
finance the European Union has also
pledged to support Youth Empowerment
initiatives to mitigate the unemployment
situation astini is highly dependent on
external sources of of income such as
regional trade remittances and transfers
from the southern African customer
Customs Union we continue to implement
structural reforms to improve our
business environment diversify our
economy and Foster inclusive growth we
have recently launched our national
implementation strategy for the Africa
Continental Free Trade Agreement two
days ago on the sidelines of of H the
United Nations General Assembly we had a
a resource mobilization session to
introduce the Africa Strategic
investment
Alliance this will uh this will support
this will support the program of the AE
trade which seeks to create a digital
marketing platform for all African
countries to promote trading through
Technologies we are also looking at the
advancement we are also looking at the
advanced countries to share their
experiences so that Africa will not be
left behind we urge member states and
the financial institutions to support
the AE trade
initiative we wish to commend the
private sector that participated at this
forum and further committed itself to
pledges towards this Noble
objective this will help us take full
advantage of the opportunities for intra
Africa trade increase National
productivity and promote Regional
Regional integration in the world's
largest free trade area that connects
1.3 billion people across 55 countries
with a combined gross domestic product
valued at 3.4 trillion us
do estin is embracing the leave no one
behind
principle which is the central promise
of the 2030 agenda for sustainable
development and its goals as we work
towards achieving these targets it is
crucial to reevaluate the Global
Financial
architecture we must address interest
rates in a way that is fair and
beneficial for both the least and
developing nations this will ensure
eradication of poverty in all its forms
and improved living conditions for the
poorest of the
poor sustaining the STG will require
that member states develop Innovative
financing strategies to ensure that
implementation reaches the most left
behind at this critical juncture
including Taiwan is an essential next
step if we are to successfully achieve
the 2030 agenda for the sustainable
development we call for taiwan's
inclusion in the United Nations system
which encompasses participation in
meetings mechanisms and and activities
that pertain to the implementation of
the sustainable development
goals this would not only strengthen
Global cooperation and partnership but
also emphasize the principle of ensuring
that no one is Left
Behind in conclusion Mr Mr President the
remaining 7 years estin will continue to
prioritize the implementation of uh the
SGS and ensure that they Remain the core
agenda behind our
development we are
optimistic that a wide range of actors
will be mobilized and that capacity
capacities will be strengthened to
ensure sure achievement of the goals by
2030 the stgs will continue to be a
Guiding Light That shapes National
policies budgets institutions
governments and sector
strategies the kingdom stands with the
rest of the world in committing to
accelerating progress in the
implementation of the UN Targets in the
remaining seven years the year
2030 the year
2023 is a turning point for the country
as we hope to break through to a better
future for all Mr President let me take
this opportunity to wish you all
successful deliberations I thank you may
almighty God bless us all
SA
[Applause]
on behalf of the assembly I wish to
thank the head of state of the kingdom
of of eswatini for the statement just
made and request protocol to escort his
majesty the assembly would
